snippet: Five construction workers are suing a longtime colleague, Americo Lopes, accusing him of cashing in a winning lottery ticket that belonged to all of them.
abstract: Five New Jersey construction workers are suing longtime colleague Americo Lopes, accusing him of cashing in a winning lottery ticket that belonged to all of them; Lopes argues that he purchased the $38.5 million winning Mega Millions ticket separately, using his own money, and that the winnings should be his alone.
lead_paragraph: Five construction workers are suing a longtime colleague, Americo Lopes, accusing him of cashing in a winning lottery ticket that belonged to all of them.

headline.seo: Co-Workers Say They Chipped In on Winning Lottery Ticket
headline.main: So You Won $38.5 Million? Not So Fast, Co-Workers Say
headline.print_headline: So You Won $38.5 Million? Not So Fast, Co-Workers Say
